publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-911# Robin Harper: Airborne Initiative-That the Parliament regrets the Scottish Executive's decision to withdraw funding from the Airborne Initiative; commends the staff for the excellent work that they have put in over the last 10 years; recognises that the initiative's strategy, in terms of what was possible, has been a huge success in that at least half of the participants completed the course and at least a quarter of these have not reoffended; notes that recent success rates show that up to 50% of those who completed the course have not re-offended; further notes that the scheme has saved the Executive between £2.8 and £4.2 million in prison costs over the last 10 years, and believes that the Executive should consider whether it has any other scheme that is likely to be anywhere near as effective in helping serious and persistent offenders back into society and out of prison on a permanent basis.

S2M-911# Robin Harper: Airborne Initiative-That the Parliament regrets the Scottish Executive's decision to withdraw funding from the Airborne Initiative; commends the staff for the excellent work that they have put in over the last 10 years; recognises that the initiative's strategy, in terms of what was possible, has been a huge success in that at least half of the participants completed the course and at least a quarter of these have not reoffended; notes that recent success rates show that up to 50% of those who completed the course have not re-offended; further notes that the scheme has saved the Executive between £2.8 and £4.2 million in prison costs over the last 10 years, and believes that the Executive should consider whether it has any other scheme that is likely to be anywhere near as effective in helping serious and persistent offenders back into society and out of prison on a permanent basis. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-911# Airborne Initiative (lodged on 12 February 2004) Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Phil Gallie*
S2M-911# Airborne Initiative (lodged on 12 February 2004) Donald Gorrie*, Fiona Hyslop*, Rosie Kane*, Mark Ballard*, Robert Brown*, Shiona Baird*, Chris Ballance*, Patrick Harvie*
S2M-911# Airborne Initiative (lodged on 12 February 2004) Mr Keith Raffan*, Eleanor Scott*, Stewart Stevenson*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Rob Gibson*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-911# Airborne Initiative (lodged on 12 February 2004) Colin Fox*
S2M-911# Airborne Initiative (lodged on 12 February 2004) Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-911# Airborne Initiative (lodged on 12 February 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-911# Airborne Initiative (lodged on 12 February 2004) Linda Fabiani*
